title: Equity Strategy: November 2012 Chart of the Month
summary: A rebound in economic data is likely but it may be more of a 2013 development. The credit conditions recovery, which began in late 4Q11, already is beginning to have impact on different reports such as job trends and the ISM. But it seems more probable that the improvements will accelerate in early 2013, leaving the proponents of a seasonal fourth quarter market surge somewhat disappointed.
tag-1: Equity Strategy: November 2012 Chart of the Month
tag-2: A rebound in economic data is likely but it may be more of a 2013 development. The credit conditions recovery, which began in late 4Q11, already is beginning to have impact on different reports such as job trends and the ISM. But it seems more probable that the improvements will accelerate in early 2013, leaving the proponents of a seasonal fourth quarter market surge somewhat disappointed.
tag-3: The election results will not solve the budget and government debt issues facing the nation overnight. While clarity may begin to emerge following the presidential election, it would be heroic to assume that whoever wins will be able to deliver a quick fix to the deficit and debt burdens that could overwhelm the country over the next several years. Indeed, a more prolonged period of steady progress should be expected rather than an easy solution due to a fairly divided political backdrop.
